result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman D Lovelace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $208.41 payable to Jacqueline, to be paid FIRST before costs, fees and surcharges. Cash bail applied.

BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1 only. Court WAIVED DNA surcharge on COUNT 2 as it is part of a continuous course of conduct. Pay all costs, fees, surcharges and restitution. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied. Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds/earnings.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program ONLY if he has not participated in the program before. The defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count 2; credit for 153 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No Contact with the victim or the co-defendant.
- Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal substances.
- Random urine screens.
- Maintain full time employment of at lease 40 hours per week, or vocational/education programming, or a combination of both.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roman D Lovelace

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
At the hour of 1:50 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 & 2 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Exhibit list received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Juror deliberations resumed at 9:42 a.m. Three jury questions received and filed. Parties notified. Written responses to each question returned to the jury room. Sheriff's Deputies Terrell & Mazurozak duly sworn for purposes of deliberations.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Gasser, Milwaukee Police Officer Damon Wilcox. State rests. Jury out of the box: 2:15 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied by the Court. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his right to testify. Jury in the box: 2:23 p.m. Sworn for the defense: Tina T-C. Defense rests. Sworn for the State on rebuttal: Milwuakee Police Officer Michael Gasser. State rests. Exhibits 5-8 received. Testimony closed. Jury out of the box: 2:41 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Jury in the box: 3:11 p.m. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by State and defense. Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:48 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Kashishian & Jones who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury in the box: 4:44 p.m. Court instructed jury. Jury released for the day at 4:48 p.m. and ordered to return at 9:00 a.m. on 1/13/16 for continued deliberations. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Court ordered witness sequestration. Jury in the box: 10:28 a.m. Jury panel sworn. Court instructed jury. Opening statements by State and defense. Jury out of the box: 10:52 a.m. Discussion regarding prior convictions of the State's first witness. Jury in the box: 10:59 a.m. Sworn for the State: Thomas C., Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Gasser.  Exhibits 1-4 received. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 11:56 a.m. Case adjourned to 1:15 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are still prepared to proceed. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:17 p.m.  Jury out of the box: 4: 33 p.m. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. Jury in the box: 4:46 p.m. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 5:00 p.m. Case adjourned to 1/12/16 at 9:30 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Discussion regarding the tape of the 911 call that is no longer available. Defense requested to call a witness for the 911 call. Court granted defense request. The court still has a speedy trial set before this case. Court ordered the case passed to 1:30 p.m. to address the court calendar.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/26/2015.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation report received and filed.
Defendant previously posted $500.00 cash. Defendant must post an additional $4,500.00.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant Roman D Lovelace not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for bail hearing. Discussion regarding the Justice Point violation and the defendant's new pending case 15CF4345. Court ordered cash bail increased to $5,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point monitoring. All conditions previously ordered remain the same, including no contact with the victim. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 1/11/16. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be reassigned to Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  If there are motions to be filed, movant has until 8/12/15; response due by 9/01/15; reply due by 9/08/15.  All substantive jury instructions, witness lists, substantive jury instructions and motions in limine are due one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and set the matter before Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Gasser-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J. GRACE, T. CARTER, A. CATHEY OR THEIR RESIDENCE; AND CO-DEF:  MATTHEW APPLETON.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roman D Lovelace in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Roman D Lovelace in custody.  William Nathaniel Gale Barron appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
